greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: E.g.f. cosh(x)/(1+x).
comment: Unsigned sequence satisfies a(n)=n*a(n-1)+a(n-2)-(n-2)*a(n-3), a(0)=1,a(1)=1,a(2)=3 with e.g.f. cosh(z)/(1-z). - Mario Catalani (mario.catalani(AT)unito.it), Feb 07 2003

The positive sequence has e.g.f. cosh(x)/(1-x), with a(n)=sum{k=0..floor(n/2), binomial(n,2k)(n-2k)!}. It is the mean of the binomial and inverse binomial transforms of n!. - _Paul Barry_, May 01 2005
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..449
formula: E.g.f.: U(0)/(1+x) where U(k)= 1 + x^2/((4*k+1)*(4*k+2) - x^2*(4*k+1)*(4*k+2)/(x^2 + (4*k+3)*(4*k+4)/U(k+1))) ; (continued fraction, 3rd kind, 3-step). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Oct 22 2012
maple: restart: G(x):= cosh(x)/(1+x): f[0]:=G(x): for n from 1 to 21 do f[n]:=diff(f[n-1],x) od: x:=0: seq(f[n],n=0..20); # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Apr 03 2009
results.author: _R. H. Hardin_
ext: Extended with signs by _Olivier Gérard_, Mar 15 1997
